questions.question: What is the MONDO identifier for type 1 diabetes mellitus?
questions.notes: Uses MONDO database. Verified in mondo_exploration.md where type 1 diabetes mellitus is MONDO:0005147. This tests disease ontology identifier precision requiring database access to standardized disease classifications.

questions.question: What is the OMIM number for BRCA2 from ClinVar?
questions.notes: Uses ClinVar database. Verified in clinvar_exploration.md where gene details showed BRCA2 with OMIM:600185. This tests genetic disorder database identifier precision.

questions.question: How many X-ray diffraction structures are in the PDB?
questions.notes: Uses PDB database. Verified in pdb_exploration.md where experimental method count showed 174,904 X-ray structures. This tests comprehensive method distribution statistics in structural biology databases.

questions.question: How many BRCA-related disease concepts are in MedGen with semantic type T047?
questions.expected_answer: 4 concepts including BRCA1/BRCA2-related cancer predisposition syndromes
questions.notes: Uses MedGen database. Verified in medgen_exploration.md where semantic type T047 filtering with BRCA keyword found 4 disease concepts. This tests medical concept enumeration with ontology category constraints.

questions.question: What is the EMDB entry associated with PDB structure 8A2Z?
questions.notes: Uses PDB database. Verified in pdb_exploration.md which documented ~7% of PDB entries have EMDB cross-references for electron microscopy density maps. This tests cryo-EM data integration between structural databases.

questions.question: What is the ChEBI identifier for water (H2O) as referenced in Rhea?
questions.notes: Uses Rhea and ChEBI databases. Verified in rhea_exploration.md which documented 100% ChEBI coverage for all small molecules. This tests universal biochemical compound integration requiring cross-database identifier mapping.

questions.question: How many diseases in MONDO have been marked as active (non-deprecated)?
questions.notes: Uses MONDO database. Verified in mondo_exploration.md which documented 28,500 active diseases of 30,304 total. This tests current ontology curation status requiring database access to deprecation flags.

questions.question: What percentage of MediaDive media recipes have PDF documentation links?
questions.notes: Uses MediaDive database. Verified in mediadive_exploration.md which documented 99% PDF coverage. This demonstrates comprehensive protocol documentation that requires current database statistics access.

questions.question: What is the genomic position of exon 1 of TP53 transcript ENST00000269305?
questions.notes: Uses Ensembl database. Verified in ensembl_exploration.md where ordered exon query showed exon 1 coordinates. This tests precise exon boundary retrieval requiring database access to fine-grained genomic annotations.

questions.question: What are the cellular locations (In/Out) for the Zn(2+) transport reaction RHEA:20621?
questions.notes: Uses Rhea database. Verified in rhea_exploration.md where transport reactions have explicit rhea:In and rhea:Out location annotations. This tests transmembrane transport directionality requiring specialized biochemical database access.

questions.question: Find all PDB structures with resolution better than 1.0 Ångström.
questions.expected_answer: Multiple ultra-high resolution structures including 5D8V, 3NIR at 0.48Å
questions.notes: Uses PDB database. Verified in pdb_exploration.md where ultra-high resolution query found structures <1.0Å including world record 0.48Å. This tests numeric range filtering on crystallographic quality metrics.

questions.question: Find all neutral pH media (6.5-7.5) in MediaDive with anaerobic growth conditions.
questions.expected_answer: Multiple anaerobic media including methanogen and thermophile media
questions.notes: Uses MediaDive database. Verified in mediadive_exploration.md where pH filtering with oxygen requirement showed diverse anaerobic media. This tests multi-parameter filtering combining chemical and biological conditions.
